Delete everything from PostgreSQL table except specified data

Source: R/rdb.gen.R
pg_tbl_keep.Rd

Delete everything from PostgreSQL table except specified data

Usage

pg_tbl_keep(tbl, data, pk_col_name)

Arguments

tbl

PostgreSQL database table from which data is to be deleted. A tbl.src_dbi object.

data

Table data to keep. A data frame that must contain the table's primary key column. Additional columns are ignored.

pk_col_name

Primary key column name. A character scalar.

Value

The updated table data as a tibble, invisibly. Note that newly inserted rows aren't included if the table's primary key column is GENERATED ALWAYS.

See also

Other PostgreSQL functions exec_sql_file(), pg_col_metadata(), pg_drop_tbls(), pg_has_tbl(), pg_init_aux_tbls(), pg_init_db(), pg_init_main_tbls(), pg_pk(), pg_reset_db(), pg_tbl_del(), pg_tbl_update(), read_sql_file(), split_sql_str()
